meanings.definition: A system of government in which a deity is recognized as the supreme ruler.
meanings.sent1: In the thearchy of ancient Greece, Zeus was considered the ultimate ruler.
meanings.sent2: The thearchy of the Aztec civilization revered multiple gods as rulers.
meanings.sent3: The thearchy of the land of candy meant that the Chocolate Deity ruled over all sweets.
meanings.sent4: The thearchy of the forest was evident as the mighty Oak God stood tall among the trees.
meanings.sent5: The thearchy of the ocean was symbolized by the majestic Poseidon ruling the waves.

meanings.definition: The rule or dominion of a god or gods.
meanings.sent1: The thearchy of the Norse gods was depicted in their epic tales.
meanings.sent2: In ancient Egypt, the thearchy of Ra was widely worshipped.
meanings.sent3: The thearchy of the playground was evident as the Slide God reigned supreme.
meanings.sent4: The thearchy of the sky was illustrated by the Sun God's daily journey.
meanings.sent5: The thearchy of the mountains was felt as the Peak Deity watched over the land.

meanings.definition: The divine power or authority of a god.
meanings.sent1: The thearchy of the thunderstorm was evident in the booming voice of Thor.
meanings.sent2: The thearchy of the harvest was celebrated through offerings to Demeter.
meanings.sent3: The thearchy of the kitchen was upheld by the mighty Chef Deity.
meanings.sent4: The thearchy of music was felt as the Melody God's tunes filled the air.
meanings.sent5: The thearchy of wisdom was embodied by the all-knowing Owl Deity.
